Name:
HMS Hyacinth
Apostolis
Builder: Harland and Wolff, Belfast, Northern Ireland
Out of service:
Transferred to the Royal Hellenic Navy on 24 October 1943
1952
Reinstated: Returned to the Royal Navy in 1952
Propulsion:
Two fire tube boilers
One 4-cycle triple expansion steam engine
Single shaft
Range: 3,500 nautical miles (6,500 km; 4,000 mi) at 12 knots (22 km/h; 14 mph)
Armament:
1 × QF 12-pounder 12 cwt naval gun (3-inch/40)
2 × .50 cal machine gun twin machine guns
2 × 0.303-inch Lewis machine guns
2 × stern depth charge racks with 40 depth charges
